description:
<p>We have an exciting opportunity in our Clacton dialysis clinic for a registered nurse who wants to make a difference in our patient’s lives. You will provide patient care according to Diaverum procedures and in order to increase the quality of life for our patients. A comprehensive professional training programme will be provided to you, including on-the-job training, e-learning and access to our in-house education programme ‘d Academy’.<br /><br />RESPONISIBILITIES:<br />• Take ownership of care programmes for renal patients including the initiation and termination of dialysis, whilst providing stable clinical care, emotional support and independence for patients<br />• Follow the tailored care plans to administer medications, fluid therapy or other appropriate treatments as per Consultant instructions and ensuring clinical activity is appropriately documented in the patient medical record<br />• Review pre and post haemodialysis care with patient<br />• Discuss health concerns with patient; review any concerns with the multi-disciplinary team as necessary<br />• Prepare and monitor dialysis machines and systems in line with Diaverum processes<br />• Monitor dialysis water treatment system for use according to the established procedures<br />• Act as a named staff nurse for a group of assigned patients ensuring ‘great care‘ is provided at all times<br />• Proactively participate in quality and service improvement programmes<br /><br />REQUIREMENTS:<br />• NMC Registered General Nurse<br />• Awareness and Understanding of NMC code of professional conduct<br />• Be able to work autonomously and within a multi-disciplinary team<br />• Haemodialysis experience desirable but not essential as training can be provided.</p>
<p>Have a positive and dynamic approach to providing safe and effective delivery of care<br />• Excellent communication skills with fluency in English<br /><br />COME GROW WITH US!<br />• Full Time - 37.5 hours per week<br />• Monday to Saturday, Shifts hours from 06.00 to 23.30 (No Nights* or Sunday working)<br />• Competitive Salary , Unsocial Payments*, Location Allowance*<br />• 27 days annual leave (plus Bank Holidays) increasing with service<br />• Life Assurance, Discounted Fitness Membership, Stakeholder Company Pension<br />• Relocation allowance *<br />• Post subject to References, Identification, DBS and OH checks<br />* where applicable/dependent on clinic</p>
title: Staff Nurse
